column5: Thanks Narda If the Lac Seul every other year trip fails to happen next year I would really like to come up to Birchdale to fish with the group. I used to come up with my first wife and really enjoyed it. Lots of good memories with Ernie, Greg and Lynn Marilynn Nickolas and the whole crew. I know the camp has changed hands , but it is still the first place I fished in Canada. One of my best memories is my 5 year old son catching a 30 inch Northern of off the dock at Birchdale at sunset. What a wonderful picture. The next week at the fish fry Greg presented him with a certificate and a frisbee and a fishing lure. Great memories..
Greg still guides on Eagle and you can check his website at www.eagleeyeguiding.com
Has anyone tried Drop Shotting on Eagle Lake for Small Mouths? If so what was your results. It will be challenging but I am willing to give it a try.

Going to Eagle Lake Aug. 24. I want to try a drop shot rig using a leech for walleye. I saw a video on youtube of a leech on a drop shot rig. I think it would work good for smallmouth, walleye , or northern on Eagle Lake.
Thanks for the tip! Have a great time.

If you get up to Eagle Lake before we do, let me know if drop shotting worked. My wife and I are going up from Aug. 24-29, and are staying at Cedar Point Lodge. It will be our first time there so I hope we have good weather and can find some fish. Good luck.
Going to be at Birchdale Lodge ( Around the bend from Cedar point ) September 6th-15th. Good luck , have fun and let me know how you do.
Bobbajig , sent you an IM in regards to Eagle Lake. Enjoy!!!

Should work great. I used drop shotting on Perrault last week and caught a lot of smallmouth using a 5" smoke rootbeer senko. I ran the dropper 18" below the hook to give the senko more distance to flutter down. The smallmouth could not resist it. Good Luck.
Thank you! Been going to Canada for 16 years, thought I would try something new. Never gets old.

Wish we were going to Birchdale. I have a bunch of good memories there. I used to go there with my former wife. You must have been going there when Ernie ran it . I don't know how to do IM . If possibble I will let you know how fish are biting. Have a great trip. The steaks at the Bullpit are awesome!!
Bobbajig, Cedar Point is a great camp, you will have a great time. Tell Wayne (one of their guides) that Terry said hi. Oxdrift2 is one of the NARDA Guys, you should join us next year at Birch Dale.
